chara.textHome:
Brrr, the wind is so cold today...
I suppose that could mean we're
going to have a white Christmas.

Good morning. It's been so cold lately,
it's a real challenge to leave my warm
bunny pillow in the morning...

But today's Christmas Eve,
that's why I'm up bright and early!

It's a little crazy right now because we're
having a party with everyone later today!

I wonder how much Yachiyo plans
to make for the party...

When you're done shopping,
would you like to walk home together?

I heard the Christmas lights hung up
all over town are really pretty...

Today was really fun, but we still have to
try and get enough rest.

You know what happens if you don't sleep...
Santa won't visit.

It's winter vacation right now,
so everyone's gathered in this house...

When everyone's together like this,
it makes our home feel warmer.

Adults and children alike look forward
to this day all year!
I won't let some Witch ruin it for them!
Let's do this!

Yachiyo said that if you get too carried away,
a Witch might lead you astray...
I hope Tsuruno is careful...

For some reason, I feel like Christmas
this year is going to be the best one yet.

Maybe because Yachiyo and the others
are here with me...

I remember when I was little, and my breath
came out white in the cold... I got so shocked
because I thought I was breathing smoke!
My parents laughed at me...

I've only ever celebrated Christmas with
Ui at the hospital.

I hope we can celebrate it together
again soon...

Now that we're the ones playing Santa,
does that mean we aren't kids anymore?

Maybe I'm just getting ahead of myself?
*Giggle*

The colder it gets, the more of a pain
it is to leave the house...

No wonder Felicia spends so much timeâ€”
Wait, Felicia?
You haven't touched your homework?!

Back when Yachiyo's place was a boarding
house, they used to always have parties.
They even used this tree back then, too.

Come to think of it, Sana's put more effort
into hanging decorations than anyone else...

She even hung up the ones
Felicia was supposed to do.

Couples treat Christmas Day as a
really romantic day in Japan...

I see it in movies and on TV.
I still don't quite understand it...
H-hey, please don't stare...

I'm not used to wearing things like this,
it's kind of embarrassing...
